junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());

Here's an interesting one for a list in the "what not to do with
junit".

I took over some code from my developers and was going to show them
how easy it is to write tests with junit. I could not compile the
tests if my life depended on it, and I had my own test cases that
compiled over and over.

I went to compile the newly created MapperTest.java and ran into this
problem:

MapperTest.java [14.1] No method found matching run(Test)
	junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
MapperTest.java [18.1] Incompatible type for return.
	return new TestSuite(MapTest.class);
2 errors

Now, I did a search within this group for any hints why this would
occur, since I've never had the problem before. I have not found
anything yet, but have found the solution. I thought I should share
the experience.

Within the same package as where the MapTest.java was, existed a
Test.class (and Test.java). The developer's Test.class did not have
the appropriate run method, and therefore could not work.

Not that anyone would ever have this problem starting out with junit,
but if you happen to take over code from developers and they've
created a Test.class within the package, just delete or rename the
Test.class and all will go back into the green.

Hopefully this will help someone someday.

Terry
